metadata.title: CVE-2022-41853 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.description: Those using java.sql.Statement or java.sql.PreparedStatement in hsqldb(HyperSQL DataBase) to process untrusted input may be vulnerable to aremote code execution attack. By default it is allowed to call any staticmethod of any Java class in the classpath resulting in code execution. Theissue can be prevented by updating to 2.7.1 or by setting the systemproperty "hsqldb.method_class_names" to classes which are allowed to becalled. For example, System.setProperty("hsqldb.method_class_names", "abc")or Java argument -Dhsqldb.method_class_names="abc" can be used. Fromversion 2.7.1 all classes by default are not accessible except those injava.lang.Math and need to be manually enabled.

criterions.comment: hsqldb package in esm-apps/focal is affected and may need fixing.
